description:
The Richmond district is known for Asian food, so I searched up a Thai place and found King's Thai Cuisine. I had one of the best Pad Z-Ew ever! I'm usually worried that the restaurant would put too much soy sauce and it would come out too salty, but this place put just the right amount. Thankfully, the beef was well cooked (some places don't cook it all the way through and it's unpalatable). The beef slices were quite thin, which made it easily edible as opposed to thick slices. I liked their choice of Chinese broccoli as the vegetable stir fried with the noodles. From sharing a Tom Yum soup, I would say it's more mellow compared to other places, which some people prefer. Personally, I like spicy and sour Tom Yum soups. 

I feel like they could have tried a little harder with the restaurant decor. Some cultural artifacts would be appreciated, as opposed to bland tables and chairs. The ceiling still looks like the standard grids you see in offices. However, the up side is that the tables can be easily arranged to accommodate groups of varying sizes. The menu is quite extensive, offering many options such as vegetarian food, curry, soup noodles, and dessert. It is one of the most variegated I've seen in Thai restaurants.
author: Louis Suo L.

description:
I came here hangry and not caring what I ate, dinner was delayed for a really long time. My partner had an alleycat race that day and then I got a handle bar ride around north beach from Chinatown to get food.. but we didn't eat.. and then we went to a park to drink some beers for his friend's birthday.. 

----

But the duck curry here was pretty good. Came here on a fleet week Friday close to midnight and stayed here probably past midnight.

I can't remember what it was exactly, but we didn't feel like they should've been tipped much for some reason... We still tipped, but yeah..

But, the food was good!
author: Lilian L.

description:
You know those places you say you'll never go back to but out of hunger, lack of late night options, and convenience you somehow end up there again? This is that place. 

The customer service is AWFUL. The waitresses could not be more rude even if they tried. The food is okay at best. Sometimes too salty, probably from the waitresses' attitude. If you have nowhere else to eat in the inner Richmond, I guess this is better than nothing.
author: Antonella H.

description:
The second time I went back, I ordered the Pad Prik Khing. It was literally straight up salty. Me and my friend (who ordered the Thai chicken basil) who are from Thailand were not impressed with that night's orders whatsoever. It was so salty that we have to keep drinking water just to chase it down. 

Kind of disappointed...
author: Yuan Z.

description:
I came here at 1:30 AM to get some Duck Pad Z-Ew.
It was after a farewell party for one of my good friends and the purple neon signs got me.

One of my worries is that the restaurant would put too much soy sauce.
Unfortunately, that was what happened, it felt like a bit drenched in sodium and a bit overpowering.
There was a decent amount of duck, at first glance, but it turned out to be mainly duck skin.
The noodles themselves, albeit salty, were cooked nicely and the Chinese broccoli was still crunchy.

It took a while for the dish to come out, despite all other tables having already received their food.

Another thing was that they were upset that my duck dish ended up being only $14.50, but not meeting the $15.00 minimum for credit card transactions.
'Next time', they said sternly... but I'm not sure if there will be a next time.
author: Kevin W.

description: 3.5- Came in for lunch and ordered the pad Thai with shrimp and the coconut soup with chicken and mushrooms. Both dishes were good but nothin special. A bit on the bland side-Unlike the other King Thai across the street which leaves you craving more. Our waitress was nice but was absent for most of our meal, never really checked on us to see if we needed anything more- which we did. Oh well. Nice try.
author: Eva C.

description: My favorite dish here is the Pad Kee-Mao. It's not normally served at other Thai restaurants. They are thick noodles with ground beef and green beans. So good and so spicy!
author: Mai N.

description:
People are getting the other location of this restaurant on Clement, which is called King's Thai Noodles #1, confused with this place, which is KTN #2.  This is the fancier one near 4th Street that has terrible food and service (see my earlier review and other reviews).  #1 is the location closer to 8th St. that has the purple storefront and, although VERY basic interior (e.g., fluorescent lighting), has WAY WAY better food, better prices and much nicer servers.  If you don't mind the casual interior you will have a much better eating experience at King's Thai Noodles #1.  It's hard to believe the two restaurants are related, they are world's apart in quality.

(Double-check you got the right location when leaving a review!   )
author: Merrick W.

description:
When I lived in the inner Richmond area this was my late night place to eat when from a hard days work. I moved back home to Hawaii and this is still one of my go to places when I visit The Bay. 

Surrounded by a bunch of Asian markets and restaurants, King of Thai, which used to be called King of Thai Noodle, is the best place for Thai in that area. Although the prices have changed the quality and quantity of the food is huge. So it'll definitely curb your appetite. 

You have to order the Papaya Salad. It's a must try. So tasty with a bit of a kick to it. The crab fried rice is also a staple for us when we order. You also can't go wrong with Panang Curry. Just the rice and curry alone is enough to feed 4 people. Pad Thai is also one of those things that have to compliment your Thai meal, so be sure to get an order. 

The place is still a little tight. Not good for big crowds. But definitely order your food and have a seat while you wait. The smells of all those ingredients being put together is amazing!!!
author: Jeff L.

description:
I work a couple of block away and decided to take a walk on clement to get lunch. I noticed a visa and MasterCard logo on the window, and I figured i'll give this place a try.  

The break down: 
Food: 3/5.... mediocre food but good sized portion. 
Service: 2/5... My waiter never checked in on me.

The reason I give this place a 1 star is because they have $15 minimum charge for credit cards.  I thought this is ridiculous since my total bill was $13.51.  The waiter said I can order a Thai Tea or something else. 

I didn't want to order anything else. I asked the waiter to charge me the .25 cent fee it will cost to swipe my card.  She said no, and was persistent that I ordered something else. It was until I said,  "just charge me the 15 dollars, but I will not tip," that she swiped my card for 13.51.

What gets me angry is that they are robbing customers of a few extra bucks. I am sure an average bill after tax for a single person is around $13- $14. They set the minimum right above the average cost, and expect customers to buy more to meet the minimum requirement. If that's not robbery, what is?  If that's not the case, they should charge a small  credit card fee.

Because the owners are cheap, and scam their customers, they lose a potential loyal customer.... over a couple of cents(transaction fees).
author: Ngoc T.

description:
This is my favorite Thai restaurant to go to in the city. I've been coming to this place since it was still named King of Thai during my high school years. The food quality and taste continues to be top notch.

I've gotten many dishes here: pad see ew, pad kee mao, kao pad, etc. but my absolute favorite dish that I get every single time nowadays is the kao pad gai tod, which is the fried chicken over fried rice.

The portion size of the fried chicken over fried rice is ENORMOUS. Two people can share one plate and they'll both be full. BUT IT'S SO DELICIOUS THAT I FINISH IT EVERY TIME. The chicken is crispy on the outside, and tender and juicy on the inside. I like to cut the chicken into bite sized pieces and dip each one in the sweet chili sauce before popping them into my mouth. I also like to get some of the green pickled chili slices from the side containers and drop some on my chicken and fried rice when I want some extra spice. The fried rice is very tasty to eat by itself too.

Free parking is a pretty hard to find around this area, so you may have to settle for metered spots if you drive here. I like this place more than the other King's Thai Cuisine on 8th avenue because this one is bigger, cleaner, and credit card is accepted ($15 minimum).
author: Wesley S.

description:
I'm not sure why this place only has 3 stars- it's pretty decent thai food. I came here for a quick lunch. I got the thai iced tea and the beef pad thai. 

The food portion is pretty large and the service is quick. I believe there are two King's thai cuisine and they're both on the same street or pretty close. 

If you're craving thai food- decent spot!  It wasn't super pricey either. I think if you get an entree and drink it will be abt 20 which is normal for like dine-in places.
author: Jessie H.

description: This is what they consider a Pannang to look like. Maybe fill it up for $12... never again will I eat here.
author: Justin O.

description: In the past, this place has been good but today when I ordered just Pad Thai with tofu I was pretty disappointed. The noodles were all clumped together and there was absolutely no sauce at all so the overall dish felt dry and not very tasty. I'll go here only when other places aren't open as the quality has definitely taken a hit.
author: Julie L.

description:
This is the to-go Thai spot for my boyfriend and I in the Inner Richmond. We probably get take-out from this King Thai location a couple times a month, probably for the last few years. Figured it was time I wrote a review for the place! Keep in mind though, we've never dined in - only done take out, so can't speak to the service or the ambience of the restaurant.  

Overall, pretty good Thai food for very reasonable prices, for SF and just in general too! We usually get the Pad See Ew (with chicken or seafood) and the Yellow Curry Chicken and are always very satisfied with both whenever we get it, and probably spend a little over $30, which is a steal! I'm sure there are fancier Thai places in SF, but I like classic Thai food, and this place always hits the spot for me! Highly recommend, especially if you live in the neighborhood and want to do take out - food is always ready in 15-20 minutes tops!
author: Abi R.

description:
I'm having a really tough time with this review because although food is really good, the service is awful! 
A couple friends and I used to come her often as it was one of the only late night spots around that served really good Thai food. On this particular night, we decided to come by for dinner and get our usual: a CUP of tom kha, and our individual entrees. We specifically stated that we wanted just a CUP of this soup, and we weren't told no or anything. When our orders were brought out, the waitress brought over 2 BOWLS of the tom kha and told us that they only have 1 size and that this is what we ordered. My friend and I told her we asked for a cup and that we weren't told otherwise. Another waitress came by and said they had a regular size and a bowl, and that we ordered the "bowl" instead. She tried to have us keep our bowls and we said no, we want the small size. She gave us such a hard time for no reason at all and then was rude to us for the remainder of our meal. If a bowl and a cup mean the same thing to you, then you need to correct your customers ahead of time if you don't want to you fix your mistakes.
author: Brie R.

description: Very inviting atmosphere, nice music/ambiance. Was able to get a seat immediately upon walk in. The food is 5 star for sure! We had the Fresh Spring Rolls, Crab Fried Rice, Sautéed Garlic Prawns over rice & the fried bananas with coconut ice cream  Couldn't have enjoyed the food more! The only reason we didn't give a 5 star rating is because the service is very slow, had to flag down for assistance far too many times which was a bit frustrating. Other than that I'd return for sure!
author: Tasha D.

description:
Started off our meal with a couple appetizers. The spring rolls were vegetarian, stuffed with leafy lettuce, bean thread noodles, and tofu. Alone, it was a bit of a tasteless bite. You really had to use the provided peanut sauce which was definitely a star. Made in house, this sauce comes out warm and chunky with lots of chopped peanut pieces. Our second appetizer were the curry puffs. Our puffs were definitely super overfried in my opinion - brittle and oily. But the curried potatoes on the inside had good flavor.

For entrees, we ordered a variety of dishes to pass back and forth between our party of 6. Everything more or less tasted the same unfortunately due to the excessive amount of curry. Definitely a missed opportunity to really marinate the various proteins to add just a bit of extra oomph to each dish. My favorite was probably the Siam House Special Noodles. The coconut flavor really came through in this curry tossed flat noodle dish. It also had the most variety of toppings which was nice. Second favorite was probably the duck curry despite the duck flavor really being masked. The addition of lychees to this dish gave it a nice fruit, sweet undertone though.

I also ordered a lychee iced tea to my meal. Definitely found it way too sweet though. Too bad.

All in all, our meal came out to be $125 for about 8 dishes. It definitely wasn't the best Thai food I had for the price paid.
author: Elaine Y.

description: This is fucking San Francisco - go somewhere else that wont try to yell at you for their shitty food.
author: Chase N.

description:
They brought my food out after the rest of the table finished. I asked them if they wanted to box it up, but I didn't want to pay for it since it came out 45 mins after our table. They took the food back, no apology, no nothing. Bad experience, bad service, not coming back unless it's the last Thai joint left in the city. 

suckas
author: Ryan A.

description:
As I have said in past reviews, this place is usually following a beer at Bitter End, Richmond Draught House or Steins.

Last night we had their eggplant salad, so delicious, to start.  We followed up with a beef curry, brown rice, (so so), and our favorite noodle dish.  They have Lagunitas on tap, always good with this food, I had a nice pour of Chardonnay.  

Nice atmosphere and service is very good.  One of my go to places on Clement.  Also very reasonable.  Highly recommend.
author: Carole W.

description:
This place used to be pretty decent. I've come here many times in the past and it's always been consistent.

Unfortunately, it seems like it's under new ownership. 

The food has really taken a nosedive and to top it off, they've raised prices here pretty significantly. If you're going to raise the prices, at least put out a better product than before.

The only thing I liked was the calamari appetizer. It was decent, but a little chewy. Also ordered the fried chicken fried rice which was horrible!!! Disappointing since we've ordered this dish many times in the past. 

They give you more portion, but it sucks. Chicken was super soggy and the portion of breading was falling off the chicken. Plus the rice was over cooked and nasty. 

I literally told the restaurant that I didn't like the dish and they asked me why (which I told them). No apology, but at least they took this off the bill.

Unfortunately, not coming back after this experience.
author: Jen F.

description: This is the only Thai food place in San Francisco place that is open until 2 AM!. Saved us many times when we were out late night and were very hungry to eat food.  Their seasonal coconut curry is very delicious. A must try food item. I also like their Crab Rangoon, crab fried rice and pineapple fried rice. Love this place. Have been here may times and would visit again often.
author: Devan K.

description: Nice atmosphere. The food was alright. The portions for the curry are surpriaingly quite large. Service was good. I had the pad ke mao Thai spicy which was tbe perfect amouny of spice
author: Jennifer U.

description:
I went with a group of 4 to this restaurant at about 7pm. We came in before they started to get busy and gave the waitress our order. About five other groups came in, ordered, and received their orders first. My friends and I were confused, since it was already 7:50pm, and our entrees haven't come in yet. We didn't want to be rude and waited five more minutes to ask where our food was. The main waitress came over and I spoke to her in Thai asking what happened to our food. She said that because we ordered appetizers, our entrees come after. As in, after five other medium and large groups received all their food. I was confused but the waitress insisted that this was how it worked. We got our food 15-20 minutes later. This was my first experience there during a time where they weren't that busy.

Okay, for the positive things: the restaurant has nice ambience and the lychee cocktail was so delicious! I'd recommend getting that and the crab fried rice.
author: Nassa J.

description:
Their fried rice had way too much chicken in it such that I couldn't get a spoonful of rice without a huge chunk of chicken. It also didn't really taste that good.

As for their Pad Thai, it was extremely unfamiliar tasting and only seemed to share the noodles. The ingredients and sauce tasted really weird.

Their fresh spring rolls are delicious. I recommend this.
author: Neil T.

description: After walking to get organic food on clement flee market .. Looking for Thai place to eat !! About time I give this restaurant my long overdue 5 Star yelp.. First their very consistent with their food taste.. Service is awesome with out being pushy.. Ask for suggestions they'd help you..... To taste is to believe .. Come over and try it ..-
author: Donovan L.

description:
I live two blocks away and this place is a pretty solid Thai restaurant. The service isn't all that great but the food I've ordered has always been consistent. There have been a couple of plates I've tried that weren't my personal favorites so I've refrained from ordering those and given their other items a try and it made up for the ones I didn't like. 
On my last visit with friends we ordered 3 entrees to share and an appetizer. To start off we ordered curry puffs which have become sort of my go to by now. The potatoes inside the puffs are extremely tasty and it comes with some garnish that adds a sweet subtle flavor to the puff. Then we had yellow curry with rice, Pad Kee Mao and Tom Kha. The yellow curry with rice is definitely a go to because it always tastes great with warm rice. You can choose to make it vegetarian or add protein of your choice. The Pad Kee Mao was really spicy but also tasted great. If you're not a lover of spicy things then probably avoid this dish. It was solid and we all enjoyed it. Next was the Tom Kha; this one actually left a bit to be desired. Since it was a coconut milk soup we thought it would be rich but tasted somewhat watered down but it wasn't completely horrible. 
For drinks we had their sangria and Thai tea. Both drinks were pretty great and we all enjoyed them. 
The cost of all of this was $59 and some change which is pretty affordable considering we all left really full and satisfied as well as with leftovers for the next day. 
As for the service, this restaurant is kinda popular for college students at USF so given that we went on a busy night full of college students, our server was pretty busy and it even took them a while to take our order. What made up for it was that the food came out really quick and although our main server was busy with other tables, other staff would come and constantly fill our water cups which I really appreciated.
author: Melanie L.

description:
I was pretty surprised that this place was so badly rated because this was my 5th or 6th time coming here and I've had a really good experience each time. 

It's definitely not the most extravagant interior designed Thai restaurant, but the food and prices are very decent. 

Last night, my friends and I were looking for a spot to grab a late night dinner and I recommended coming here. We arrived around 9pm and were seated immediately. We had our waitress by our side the moment we sat down and she was taking our drink orders and appetizer orders super quickly. Within 10 minutes we received our appetizers, which were very fresh and tasty, as usual. We ordered the spicy calamari, which is one of my favorites. Then we had the fried tofu with peanut sauce, which of course is always very good when it comes out hot and we also decided to try the curry puff which was a major hit at our table. Overall the appetizers were a great success and very filling, so in a sense we didn't even really need main courses, but we all love to eat, so we each proceeded to get a main dish for ourselves. 

I personally ordered the Pad Gra Praw (Minced Chicken), with a side of steamed vegetables. This dish was very light and full of flavor. My boyfriend & friend ordered the half size Tom Kah Soup, one with chicken and the other with shrimp. They both were really happy with their choice in soup, because the soup was cooked to perfection, with just the right amount of aromatic flavors. My other friend went with the chicken pad thai and was very delighted with his meal. The portions for all these items were just the right size. There wasn't too much, but there wasn't too little, so we were satisfied with our late night dinner choices. 

The final bill came out to about $70 dollars total for all the food, which is a awesome, especially with the amount of food that we ordered. 

This still stands as one of my favorite places to go to when it's late and there isn't much to choose from on a late night!!
author: Julia K.

description: The food was average Thai food. The service was just shit. We weren't told until we wanted to pay that they cannot split a bill into 7 people. Our server was just rude to us and can't even explain it to us and had to send us another server to talk to us. Obviously, the reason is that they don't want to be charged multiple transaction fees. Just ridiculous.
author: Vanessa N.

description: Quick and easy dinner or lunch spot...there fast and the food tastes good, although there service could use some work it is nothing that would stop me from going back..the highlight items are angel wings,fish cake also there fried rice and Thai rice plates are good
author: jonathan h.

description: First time at King Thai and it was delicious! Thai food is my favorite so I usually end up liking the things I try and order so there's that. Reason for the 4 stars is because I've had better. We ordered Chicken Satay, white rice and pad thai noodles. Chicken was yummy, white rice good of course but the noodles lacked some flavor I was looking for which is ok because I added some spice and it fixed it right up. Ordered chicken and they also add tofu for the none meat eaters which is great. But I ate it all and my belly enjoyed it. I will be probably be back on my next trip to SF but I will order and try something different. I recommend this place and make sure it's ***KING THAI #2 (bigger restaurant and more space vs the #1 location its more of a hole in the wall)
author: Jaymie R.

description: The service is not that good. They ignored us when we are ready to order and when we asked for the napkins. The food are ok. I only like the papaya salad and fish cakes. Other than that, I won't come back.
author: Sharon W.

description: This place never let's me down, amazing late night eats. I come for the crab ragoons, fresh rolls, curries, pad sews and crab fried rice with pineapples and they cook it on point every time. If you have room for dessert the fried banana is a must, they serve it with ice cream
author: Jeany Z.

description: Thai cuisine is my only weakness. However, here everything went wrong that time. The waitress impressed me and my friend in a bad way. Her face expressed tiredness and sickness. The food, on the other side was not so bad of you compare with her attitude We ordered the papaya salad and fish cakes. Don't know if I will be back in here.
author: Anna C.

description:
I've always really enjoyed my meals from here. The staff is nice and the food comes out quickly. I like what's on the menu, I feel like they always have a fun special or something I wouldn't typically see at other Thai restaurants. Last time I went the special was coconut curry with chicken and vegetables served inside of a coconut. It was so good! 
Portions are fair, as is the price. Would recommend this place to other people.
author: Emma B.

description: Ewww. I wish there was zero star. Waitress girl in yoga pants and black hoodie has terrible attitude, but we still tipped her decent, because we felt bad for her. My friend and I didn't finish our entree ( coconut curry and pad kee mao) , it didn't taste good. My other friend who finished her plate, she got sick and had to throw up. Don't go here, waste of time and money.
author: Tegshjargal T.

description: I usually enjoy king of thai food but this place must be a bootleg of the original. First of all the customer service needs to be more happy serving their customers ...which ....ok fine ....I understand ....it must be a long day for them at 1:30pm. Their Tom khan has too much coconut not like the original. Lack of flavor. The papaya salad I'm ok with. The pad se ew and duck fried rice is ok. I come here a few time and their dishes has always been off from the original taste. Next time I'll walk few more blocks to the original on Clement for their food.
author: Christy V.

description: I almost always order food to go and it's always ready within 15-20 minutes. Prices are low, especially for the generous portion sizes, and I think it tastes pretty good. Plus they're open til 2am so I can satisfy my late night snack cravings. Missing one star for the one time I ate in person; service is a little lacking but the atmosphere is nice.
author: Emma G.

description: The price was just okay maybe even steep for the food. The food I ordered a chicken pumpkin curry with jasmine rice was good and decent. Not my usual regular place to go to. The pumpkin curry was aromatic and tasty.
author: Wesley K.

description: They used too much sugar each portion. After eating their cuisine, I didn't eat sugar for a while.
author: Is A.

description:
Food wise this place is good! But I've knocked down a star for my last visit because the waiter served three tables before realizing he lost our tables order. Maybe investing in a bigger notebook to take orders would be a good idea. Customers don't care if you have a cute compact little notebook to write on, I'd rather the order not be lost.

Duck noodle soup seemed to be really popular on yelp so that's what I ordered and it had perfectly cooked duck that was really tender and no bones to deal with. The egg noodles were really good also! The only thing I wouldn't have wanted was that they sprinkled five spice on top as a garnish with the cilantro but it was like raw spice.
author: Laura Y.

description:
I had an awful experience in this restaurant!  The owner was disrespectful, mean, and rude with me!  I tried this place today for lunch for the first time. The food was not good.  It was too fishy because they put lots and lots of dried shrimps in my dish. 

When I went to pay with my credit card, the owner told me, very rudely, that they have a $15 minimum charge for credit cards, I asked her if she could possibly make exceptions and she said no. So I explained to her that I'm temporarily disabled. It would be very far and difficult for me to walk out to get cash. She yelled at me to go outside to get cash, otherwise I have to buy more food. I said "No" to her and told her I didn't want to buy more food.  I asked her to be more polite, and she was so angry at me. 

I briefly checked their main entrance and the windows. There was no notification or service agreement sign which specifies a minimum charge for using credit cards. I asked her why there was no posting of a large sign in a visible place. She yelled and pointed out the tiny sign right next the cash register which was far from my table. It was so tiny and impossible to read from my seat. I told her the sign is too small to see. She snatched my credit card and told me I need to follow the law. 

I told her I can't bear her rudeness and disrespectful treatment, and  I will not pay until she apologizes to me. She threatened me that she would call the police.  Three officers arrived very quickly. I explained what happened to me. One of the officers told me it's the law and I need to follow the law. However he told me I could write a Yelp review or notify the BBB (Business Better Bureau). 

I'd never ever go back to this place again.
author: Jun Y.

description: I ordered the Pad Thai and it was awful. Completely lacks taste, the noodles were clumped together, the shrimp over cooked and tough and the tofu were like pucks of oil. And no lime served to try to save this disaster. Just gross.
author: Brandi L.

description: Yeah this is a solid 3 star joint. Good prices, wide variety of food, and decent service. Sometimes the food is over cooked and sometimes its a little oily. But overall you always can expect the same thing and there's nothing wrong with that. This actually used to be my favorite hang over food many moons ago. I order the pad see ew and the friend chicken over friend rice.
author: Guisela L.

description: Went to visit this location after it's name change. When I lived in the area I'd love coming here. But in recent years service was okay. The reason why I'm giving them a  was because of being served bad food. Which cause my niece who came with me food poisoning. She has the coconut curry chicken. After leaving the restaurant she complained about not feeling so good. I had the fried chicken over fried rice. I too felt a little sick In my stomach. Later that day I took her to the emergency room because she was throwing up and diarrhea. Doctors asked if there was something we ate bad. I said to him we had thai food. He said this was a case of food poisoning. So beware of this location. I will never come back and just wanted to let everyone know too that this is what happen when we came back to visit this location. Never again!
author: Shaun E.

description:
Wow this place is pretty low. first we walk in and get seated. two other groups walk in after us and get seated. We're ready to order and wait patiently for the server even gesture that we're ready. nope. She skips us and gets the OTHER GROUPS orders and is about to walk away.

We decide to leave since that was terribly rude and she didn't even acknowledge that we were ready.

The worst part is I accidentally left behind a shopping bag with a few things I bought from goodwill. I remember literally like 2 minutes and came back to retrieve it. that's chill they have it. 

1 hr later I realize that one of my items is missing from the bag and give them a call. Obviously they're going to deny taking anything - but it's like seriously? I know it's not their responsibility and just a courtesy but that's messed up. I can replace that shirt but bro it's not a free for all. What if I left behind something else of value? I expect all my belongings to be there and I wasn't even gone for more than a few minutes! I regret not checking which should be a cardinal rule. it's a basic truth that people cannot be trusted especially most places in SF.

THIS PLACE IS SHADY AF. I could care less if the food was "good" any one with good sense should go to Thai Time or even Burma Superstar. Even if those places are packed avoid this restaurant - all they want is your money for their subpar service and apparently whatever you leave behind! Truly despicable.
author: Misty M.

description:
Visited this place on an impulse after a sudden craving of Thai food. Location was empty and kinda dark inside so we questioned if it was even open but obvi it was :-)  

My boyfriend ordered fried chicken over fried rice ($12.45) and I ordered the yellow curry with chicken ($11.45). Our server was quick, friendly, and refilled our waters. The food came out quickly and it was so YUMMY -- which made me surprised at all the negative reviews. The fried chicken comes with sweet chili sauce which you don't really need because the fried rice is sooo bomb that I kinda wish I ordered a plate to-go. My curry was very flavorful, filling, and they were generous with the chicken. It was enough to last me literally 3 meals so the price was worth! 

Would def come back again for my next Thai fix.
author: Shana N.

description: This is my second time here. We ordered the wings, pad Thai with chicken, pad see ew with beef, and the crab fried rice. Everything was delicious. The waitresses were tentative and our food came out fast. The only downfall is that it's really hard to find parking. We will definitely be back
author: Jason Y.

description:
Never, I say NEVER will I go back to this place again! This place steals your money and makes you pay for stuff you did not order! Wanna be jipped? Be my guest! 

I ordered the Guay Tiew Lord. It's $8.95, but if you want to add chicken, pork, or beef that would cost you $9.45. Shrimp and seafood would be $9.95. Roast duck $10.25. I ordered the seafood, which was $9.95. When I had gotten my receipt it was $9.95, plus and extra $3.00! I asked what the $3.00 was for and the guy plating the food said it was for the extra seafood I requested. I told him I did not request extra seafood. He called our waitress over and they were speaking in some kind of language, which we did not understand. The guy told us that our waitress said I said extra seafood. I told him I chose seafood, but the word extra did not come out of my mouth. Plus, there wasn't any extra seafood.

My husband ordered the Kao Pad Gai Tod which is the fried chicken and rice. He always orders the same thing every time we come here. It comes with 2 1/4 sliced tomato, but this time it came with 3. So basically they gave him 3/4 of a tomato. 1/4 of a slice was an extra $1.00! Oh heavens! When they say every little bit counts, this restaurant will make sure they get a little bit out of every customer.

The guy was rude. It's not our fault his staff couldn't understand a lick of English! Try hiring someone who speaks both languages. This is America you know! 

Oh yea, also in the bathroom all the toilet paper was on the dirty nasty floor. Try wiping your privates with dirty toilet paper filled with bacteria. I had to use the toilet seat protector!
author: Darlene M.

description: Lovely   place...fast service and reasonably priced; ..I look forward to dining here again !
author: Barry C.

description: Pad see ew with beef, angel wings, yellow curry oh my ! Really loved all the food , however the service is awful. Very inattentive & short.
author: Alyson T.

description:
This place is opened really late, has parking (depending on hours) can be seriously rough on weekends though. 

The ambiance is nice and the food is good! Really like the fried crab rice here. It's really good and their pineapple fried rice as well. The dessert we ordered, fried banana with coconut ice cream was delicious but wasn't on our menu for some reason, so we ordered it and wanted to add an extra scoop of ice cream but she said it would cost 3-4$ extra! D: 

There was an automatic tip because we had a party of 8 and the service was alrightios. I'd come back because they're opened late and the food isn't too bad!
author: Melanie T.

description: Oh they ain't friendly here. Lol! Our server was just tired, and I understand that- but We WERE TIRED AND HUNGRY TOO. The food taste was OKAY. We ordered Pad Thai, ( go get a soda with this cuz you need sweet to wash all the saltiness ) it was good since we like pad Thai! Price is $$, very affordable!
author: JeHsz Z.

description:
I came here with my friends after long day of volunteering. It was a rainy Sunday evening, so we wanted something warm before heading back to our university. 

We wanted something to warm our bodies, so we got a soup to share. We ordered the Tom-Kha. This was my favorite dish of the night. There was a generous portion of everything - from mushroom to shrimp. I shared the soup with four other people, we all got one bowl and there were extras! The soup is delicious and cheap! I would highly recommend getting this especially for SF's cold weather. 

I got the Pad Thai. This was a disappointment since King's Thai is supposed to be authentic Thai food. However, the noodle was way too sweet for me, I barely tasted any of the other flavors. I had to drench my noodles with hot sauce to get a kick out of it. For some reason, it was extremely difficult for me to mix the pad thai as they were just sticking to each other. 

My friends seemed to enjoy their dishes and praised that their food was delicious. I would give this place another try if there's nowhere else to eat. But then again, Burma Superstar is right around the corner.
author: Shelly S.

description: I used to live right down the street from this place, and that was super dangerous. Love that this place is open so late in the night and you can always get something really good. I highly recommend the green curry chicken, the fried chicken of fried rice is classic, pad thai, or pad kee mao! Excellent food, friendly staff, and reasonably priced!
author: Patrick W.

description: I'm a big fan of Thai food and the food tasted good so I'll give them 3 stars.  Because They fail In Price customer-service and stinginess about serving Tips. The 1st people's bills together and that is a ridiculous Amount for the gratuity fee.  And the worst part about all of it is after spending lots of money there we had to beg for A cup of water and water refills even though we bought iced coffees. If your in SF and want thai late night, You'd be better-off going to thai osha
author: Betty B.

description: I love their fried chicken over rice. Seafood and coconut curry are good also. This place is the winner because they are open till late.
author: Miner B.

description: THE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER!!  We went into this place on Monday late afternoon. The Resturant was not busy only one other party sitting but looked like they were all done eating. We were sat at a table right away. Few minutes later Our waitress took our order for appetizers and we told her place that order in and bring us tea while we decide on dinner. Few minutes later she brings us tea, stood there asking us to put in our dinner order. We told her we need few minutes more to decide. Within 2 minutes  she comes back again asking us to put in our order. So finally we rushed and put in our dinner order. 20 min later they bring out crab fried rice, and we asked what happened to our appetizers. They all look at each our like we are speaking a foreign language. So we told them to take this back and bring our appetizers first. Then the waitress comes by and say "my Bad" really!!  10 min goes by now they bring out our Pad-Thai, still no appetizers. We asked to speak to the manager. Manager is no where to be found the premises. You are in a customer service business at least make sure you employees are trained well or be available to face your customers. It felt like the kitchen didn't know how to read orders or the waitress had no clue what she was doing. We paid for our tea, and left. No apologies or even a remorse that they screwed up. NOTHING!!! We will never go here again.
author: Anita S.

description: This is the closest Thai restaurant to where I live. I ordered pad Thai for take-out once.  The portion wasn't that big. I ate all of it for lunch.  I felt like the noodles didn't have enough sauce and they didn't give enough noodles. The plastic box is big but they didn't fill it up. I didn't think it was worth around $11 for shrimp pad Thai.
author: Jennifer T.

description: Had a great experience. I believe I had the Pan-Z-We and I loved every bite of it. My girlfriend doesn't eat Asian food but she enjoyed here which was a plus. The food didn't take long to be served and the price was decent. If I was back in town I wouldn't mind coming here again.
author: Alex M.

description:
In a pinch Kings Thai Cuisine # 1 is open late and gives no attitude to late night eaters.
.
At its entrance, the kitchen occupies most of this space but once you pass it five or six tables are in the back. I was actually afraid to go in but I am happy that I did. The service was attentive and food came out very hot! 
.
I tried their Green Curry with Chicken and an Egg Noodle soup with Duck. Both were more than satisfactory. 
.
For late night food I am so happy Kings Thai 1 is open.
author: Caesar A.

description:
Had an excellent dinner last night the ladies who were running the floor last night were definitely on top of their game!

The Fried Calamari was excellent, the sauce was tangy, sweet and spicy...if you don't like it, there's something wrong with you!

The service was superb and the lady who found my property and returned it to me was an angel from heaven...truly!

I will always be a customer, supporter, advocate, ambassador, friend, consumer, raving fan, etc... for this establishments offerings! 

Do you get the idea? If so, get your behind into one of their seats and witness first hand a superiorly prepared meal and enjoy!!!

Do you think I love this place? I do!!!

The only thing missing? They don't serve breakfast!
author: Brian C.

description: ***20% SERVICE CHARGE FOR 5*** This establishment charges a 20% service charge for a party of 5. Just FYI before you go and their service is not that great. Plus the food is mediocre. We got our bill with "service charge" hand written on there.
author: Gloria R.

description: Fried chicken fried rice is a must! That's what we go here for and their hot ginger tea! The service is great and the food comes out fast.
author: Amanda C.

description: So there are tons of King of Thai locations, but this is for surr ny favorite. They also recently remodeled, so the interior looks really nice. They accept card as well so that's a huge bonus. They have a wide variety of traditional Thai cuisine. My favorite items here are the duck fried rice, chicken wings and Thai tea. The duck fried rice is really flavorful and is served in a massive portion. The chicken wings are perfectly fried and tossed in a sweet and spicy sauce then topped with basil. Overall, if you are looking for some delicioua Thai food then definitely check this spot out.
author: Cristal C.

description: This is my favorite Thai food in San Francisco! I consider it my "secret" spot for all of my friends and family who come from out of town to visit. I've had several different dishes from this restaurant and they never fail to amaze me. The tables are always clean along with the bathroom and surrounding dining area. I've been here during peak dinner hours, on a weekend night when it is extremely busy, and we have been seated, served and out the door in a very fair amount of time. I've also been here past midnight while driving by and couldn't resist. They were great when we came in with a crowd. We had 7 people and were worried that they wouldn't be able to seat all of us together since it was really busy, but we were wrong. In no time we were all sitting together eating and enjoying our appetizers! Giving 5 stars and cannot wait to go back over and over again!
author: Kevin D.

description: Sooo they're pretty racist here.  My boyfriend and I walked in around 12:45am unaware they're closing at 1am.  Ok, fine.  The waitress quickly walked up to us and asked if we can just order to go.  Ok, fine.  We agreed.  We ordered just a few Thai iced teas and the fried chicken over fried rice to go. As we're waiting for our food an Asian couple walked in damn near 5 minutes to 1am and was told the same thing.  That they're closing soon and if they can just order to go.  They declined it seemed like because the dude went to just use the bathroom and the female waited for him by the entrance.  As soon as he returned from the bathroom, I believe the owner who was sitting at the corner table near the window said something to him.  All of a sudden they're sitting down at a table!  Whaaaat?!  Hella shady!  Uh I find that so disrespectful because it was done right in front of our faces.  Fuck this establishment who obviously don't care about keeping repeat customers.  I've been coming here since God knows when!  I go to all of their locations to eat and for me to feel like this is how they treat their customers then fuck it!  I'll seriously try my very best to go elsewhere.  BTW I'm Filipino and my boyfriend is Black.  And for the food it was good!  I truly wish they can just have more appreciation for the people who pay money.  I seriously would have ordered more if I would've been able to sit down right then and there.
author: Elizabeth P.

description: Even on a busy Friday night, the servers were able to get to my party in a timely manner. Prices are pretty fair. I ordered the pumpkin curry and the pad makuer and both were delicious! Definitely will be returning.
author: Dennis X.

description: Authentic Thai food deivered fast. Affordable. I guess I'll add more words because yelp wants that
author: Jeremy S.

description: Not sure why he 3 stars.  Hole in the wall with traditional Thai food.  If you are looking for service go somewhere else.  I ordered the coconut soup with shrimp and panang with chicken and both were excellent.  The portions are also good size.
author: Michael V.

description: Horrible service!!!! Seated a large party with people hanging off the table. Couldn't even get my drinks before the next party after us got their food!! Greatly disappointed.
author: Luz A.

description:
King's Thai... King of Thai... Maybe they changed management? Menu was very similar to King of Thai and Kin of Thai Zagat frames are still on the wall so I expected the food to be the same. 

Food- I usually order the #4 at King of Thai, but decided to order the #3 here this time because I didn't feel like beef balls or sliced beef. I got it with my usual small rice noodle. Husband ordered the mixed noodle (I call it mixed because there is pork, chicken, fish cake, etc etc) in clear chicken broth. The bowls were HUGE and came out quickly. But to my disappointment, my noodles were not the same King of Thai noodles. The broth looked and tasted different and the rice noodles kept breaking when I used chopsticks to put them into my spoon. Argh! Broth was much fattier (with glops of fat on top- like ramen except this ain't ramen!) and is already spicy (which I don't mind). The biggest disappointment off all is that there was zero beef stew even though #3 is supposed to be beef stew. It was all beef tendon!!! Thank goodness I don't mind tendon! But they should really add that detail on their menu "beef tendon stew". Oh well, the hot noodles still cured my hunger on that cold rainy night. Husbands noodle I thought was better. The broth was clear as stated on the menu and it had a nice chicken flavor tho just a tad bit too salty for me. 

SERVICE/STAFF- nice and friendly staff. Orders were taken correctly (I think) and they came to check on us once during our meal. This usually does not happen at the King of Thai that we frequent to. Waitress came to give me a hot tea refill and cleared our bowls away when we were done eating but didn't pay bill or finish our drinks yet.

PLACE/DECOR- fairly clean looking tables and chairs. Photos of King and Queen of Thailand on wall. TV was playing NBA and lots of Zagat frames on the wall. Not a lot of seating, maybe around 20. Bathroom is in the back opened with sliding door, not really clean, but wasn't disgusting. 

Still deserving a solid 3 stars from me though my noodles turned out to be beef tendon noodles because it was still tasty, food came out fast, and service was good. I would come back to try other items on the menu and order other type of noodles (perhaps flat rice noodles instead of small rice noodles for less breakage).
author: Iris H.

description: Noodles were not good -- greasy, too much sugar. Soup was taste-less -- like vegetables floating in warm water. And for the 2nd time in 6 months, they forgot one of my side dishes (take out)-- think the kitchen couldn't be bothered to make it for me, and they figure you can't be bothered to make a fuss by the time you realize you didn't get your small dish.... The only reason I went back a 2nd time was because they are open late. Staff isn't particularly friendly, but I don't find them overtly rude either -- particularly as they are super busy and crazy tired by the time 10pm+ rolls around...
author: Kate A.

description: The food is ok. If the coconut duck curry sauce was a little thicker +1 for my rating but it's not..
author: Stewart M.

description: I really like the restaurant food and have been going there for the last 5 years. The only reason I give it a three stars is because their food taste is not consistent, especially the takeouts.
author: Niki Y.

description: When I called to place a big order for my family which were 8 separate items the bitch on the phone had a attitude about it which I didn't understand , I'm making your establishment money . That's the first thing . When I go pick up my families food and I which costed 150$ and I'm not complaining about that this is about customer service ...the bitch had an attitude slammed the receipt on the counter and the change in my hand ... and as I'm back in my car driving down the street I realized The lady forgot my Thai iced tea . So I had to go all the way back to get it and she still had a attitude when I came back to get my Thai iced tea that I payed for ! Moral of the story I will go spend my money at another king of Thai cuz they will never get a dollar out of me again . And the food wasn't that good anyways .
author: Tatiana M.

description: Wow! My friend Doug said this was awesome, I disagree-- idk what is beyond awesome? Amazing! Spectacular! Hands down one of the best Thai restaurants I've been to. All the dishes we had were on point! Thank you!!
author: Thelma K.

description: The worst customer service!!!! For the price pick another Thai place! The restaurant was only 10% full and three different parties walked in the workers seemed irritated that they had to Seat us. They continued gossiping in the Plain view of us finally seated us and threw menus at us and it was like watching a train wreck of terrible customer service.  The food did come out quickly.  But back to wait staff... they either ignored you and if you did get their attention were rude or irritated.  When it was time to pay... was even more rude about how we wanted to pay. NEVER AGAIN.
author: Hazel H.

description: I believe is hard to go wrong in a Thai place when you order a pad Thai and a Thai tea. It was yummy, no big deal, but good enough to decide to comeback later.
author: Juan D.

description: Haven't been this place for awhile, so decided to come back for some yummy Thai food because their food was always consistent! We ordered the beef stewed noodle soup and pad thai, the pad Thai was fine but beef noodle soup was so fucking bad! Noodle was undercooked, beef was worse, it was tough as rock! I mean there's no way you can chew it off! Complained it to the servers and they just kinda ignored it. 2 stars for the food their used to have
author: Jonathan C.

description: We ordered food to go and they did not provide ANY utensils and napkin!! We ordered seafood pad Thai, tom yum soup, Thai tea, and duck curry. The duck curry was mediocre and the others were a disappointment. The pad Thai had egg shell and seashell! If we bit hard enough, the seashell could have chipped our teeth. The tom yum soup was super spicy which some may like, but they should have different level of spiciness to chose from. So from start to finish, this place was a disappointment and I would not recommend it. Will definitely not be returning. Giving 2 stars since the curry was ok and food was edible. Not worth the money though!
author: Jen N.

description: Love this place! My favorite Thai restaurant so far! Moved here from Washington and the most comparable to some of the best up there.
author: Charlotte D.

description: The best Thai food around. I stopped going to other Thai restaurants when i discovered this one. i live in San Jose, and travel to to SF just for some Thai food when i want it. Friendly servers, reasonable prices, clean facility, great taste. I just love it.
author: Danny I.

description:
I fully empathize with the rebranding due to the current Thai political crisis. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/kings-thai-cuisine-2-san-francisco?select=XNL-qMogVE3AGfkSoauqzA) I too have been going through a Thai crisis, albeit less political and more physical.

My enrollment ended at Fight & Fitness; I can re-up with them, enroll at $El Niño$, or return to my roots at World Team USA.

Not a simple choice. Good thing food is a simple choice - I got "Mee Krob Rad Nar" because it had the word "Rad" in it. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/kings-thai-cuisine-2-san-francisco?select=SNeB3qwKu9j1YVmqZOxYFg) (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/kings-thai-cuisine-2-san-francisco?select=bO5QhJQK_cM_okekTIB2Kw) Done & Doner. #fatguyinalittlecoat #twodifferentreferences
author: Dan B.

description:
This is not where one wants to be! My cousin ordered red curry which didn't taste like it at all! On top of that, the waiter got us water after the main course was served. We had no napkins and forks which we had to borrow from adjacent table! After all these there was no point to tip! 
THIS GOES WORST NOW: While on road, a woman comes screaming to us asking why we didn't leave tip! Hello world, no one does that!
author: Pujan D.

description: Where not to eat in SF. I went in,  lady motioned me to sit anywhere.  Waitress passed me by at least 6 times. Never acknowledged I was even there. Waited 14 minutes , no service. Left.
author: Don P.

description:
This is one of two locations on Clement St that were formerly King of Thai Noodles (the other is between 7th and 8th on the south side of the street). A message in the window from the owner explains that there was a family dispute (I understand it's over politics in Thailand) and they separated from the original KOTN. The KOTN locations have gone more upscale and raised their prices, while King Thai Cuisine is closer to the original menu which is a very good thing.

Still, I think you should consider the funkier original location up the street before settling in here. For two reasons: first, the other one is marginally cheaper--$7.75 vs $8.45 for beef noodle soup as of August 2015. Second, they've doctored the menu with white-out up the street rather than reprinting it, which means it has more items on it (though not all may be avallable).

But if you get a parking spot and don't feel like an exploratory walk, this place is just fine. And definitely better than the KOTN side of the family.
author: Otis M.

description: Decent, if not memorable Thai cuisine. We came here when a restaurant across the street that we wanted to go to had a super long wait. I'm not even 100% sure exactly what we ordered, but it was a curry and a pad see ewe or a pad thai dish. The service left a little to be desired... They were slow to refill water and only let us split a tab for 6 across 2 credit cards. The vibe is a little strange too... Very big and the lighting makes it feel sort of like a nightclub. I'd come back but wouldn't seek it out.
author: Allison M.

description:
Wow the worst customer service ever! Had to wait for water 10 min and order 30min really at 10pm only 4 tables taken and 3 servers ?
How ever the food is OK
author: Serge B.

description: So disappoint!! What he service, horrible!!When I order papaya salad, I specify mentioned "Non Spicy please, it is  for my kid". I ended up receiving really spicy order. I called the store to make complain. The girl pick up the phone , I told her that I got the wrong order. She did not apologize and hang up my phone. How rude! I called second time the other girl pick the phone and  could not do anything coz my order was done by previous shift time person. This is not acceptable!
author: Vilan H.

description:
Duck pad Kee Mow is so on point, duck was soon tender and  so good.

Beef larb, so fire. Must come back. 

EXCELLENT service. Fast. Despite being crowded at 9pm on a Saturday.
author: Ray S.

description:
I don't even know why I bother coming back to this place at all. The food is good, I give them that. But, the service here is terrible and it has been for years. I don't come here often -- but when I do, I have some false sense of hope that maybe, just maybe, "this time the service won't be so bad." Well, like I said, false hope. 

I've come here with different people and each time is no different than the last. You walk in, awkwardly standing there for minutes waiting to get seen so that you can get seated. Once they finally assign you to a table, they disappear for another 15 minutes and don't even provide a glass of water at the very least. It's impossible to flag them down. I'm literally at the table, raising and waving my hand like an elementary school student, hoping that you'll call on me next! Finally, they see you, and you receive the worst attitude for flagging them down. "Hold on, please!" Then, they disappear for another 15 minutes. Each time, I have to wait a *minimum* of 30 minutes to get some food served (even water). 

I usually give tips, even to mediocre service... Because everyones' gotta make a living, right? But my very last experience here was so bad, I just couldn't tip anymore. And it will probably be my last time here for good. 

It's unfortunate, it really is. I say that because the food is really good. It's quality. It's flavorful. But by the time you get your food, you're already turned off from the service (or lack thereof).

Please do something about it.
author: Rayne K.

description: We ordered duck noodle soups with flat rice noodle, but the server who took our order gave us duck fried rice. I could barely understand her English when she came take our order, so my husband even pointed at the specific item on the menu, telling her that we wanted to order to duck noodle soup with flat rice noodle. After the other male server brought us the duck fried rice, me and my husband stated that we got the duck flat rice noodle soup not the fried rice. However, since me and my husband were in a rush, we accepted the wrong order. But both of the servers did not even come say sorry, the male server just placed the wrong order on our table and not saying a word, turned his back and left. The fried rice actually tasted not bad at all, but the one star goes to the service. No one had come to our table during our meal, and my husband even had to get up to the cashier to pay for the check. The server's attitude is not acceptable at all.
author: Kah L.

description: I love walking here for noodles or curry after a trip to Green Apple Books. The mango sticky rice is out of this world, and the staff are courteous and friendly.
author: J T.

description:
This place fell off since the name change.  Portions are smaller.  Doesn't taste as good. Gave me the wrong dish. Pad Thai and pad see ew don't even sound the same (granted I prob have a terrible accent). So disappointed.

Redeemed. Still solid.
author: Anthony N.

description:
Bomb as Phuc! My Baby Bro took me here for a late snack. He ordered regular steamed rice, fried-breaded calamari and glazed chicken wings. All items were excellent. Food came quickly and presented beautifully. Chicken was delicious. 

I particularly liked the fact that the steamed rice was cooked perfectly to compliment the 2 dishes. The rice was not soggy or sticky. Hard and dry with just enough moistness. Had a Tiger Beer to wash it down.

Environment was tight and intimate. Everybody is talking, nice and ambient.
author: Tri H.

description:
What I like about this place is purely out of convenience. It is open late and pretty close to my apt. Its not the best, but its definitely not the worst. Like I said.. convenience... 
I ordered the pad thai from here the other day for take-out and i really wish I had ordered something else. On the other hand, I ordered these curry puffs as apps and they were amazing! Maybe it was an off night for the pad thai, but I just wasn't feeling it. It was bland and I had to drench it in lemon and other seasonings to eat. Also The curry I got once was extremely oily, but good. Just don't get the pad thai and you will be fine. Considering all the other options in the area, I would only come here if it is late night. The curry puffs tho. They were  awesome.
author: Thielson D.

description: Very sub par. Service was just okay. Food was dry and lacking finesse. I can't even say it was good. I don't recommend it.
author: Suzanne H.

description:
Low prices and good service is all I can recommend about it. That and they have Lagunitas on tap. We came here on Friday around 7 starved after B Star told us it would be a 45 minute wait. The egg rolls were piping hot but lacked flavor the other appetizer, some sort of a fried cake with pork and shrimp had heavy unpleasant mouth-feel  and tasted like Spam. 
Then the entrees - 3 tries and 3 strikes. 
The Pumpkin Curry had a delightful fragrance but was so spicy as to be inedible and I love spicy food.  
The other 2 dishes were lost in a sea of disappointment  I've had so much great Thai food here in the Bay Area this was shamefully bad 
It was hardly better than starving
After seeing other reviews I wanted to say how great the service was. Our waitress even reseated us to s nicer booth that we had requested earlier when it became available
author: Clinton G.

description: love the pad z euw, the green curry, and the hot ginger tea
author: Kate F.

description: I used to love this place, but it's recently gone downhill for me. On separate occasions, I've gotten noodles that taste burnt &portions that are 1/2 of what they used to be. Super inconsistent. The food definitely doesn't taste as good as before. What happened to this place?!
author: Sabrina S.

description:
I don't know what happened to this location! It used to be bomb but now it's less than a shadow of its former glory. My mild mannered, even tempered brother ordered the basic shrimp Pad Thai and they couldn't even get it right. The shrimps they used were probably dead shrimps because it tasted fishy and the texture was soggy. My brother was so upset, he didn't eat any of it after trying multiple times to eat it without gagging. My mom's basil ground beef stir fry was SOOO salty; even my boyfriend who loves salty food couldn't handle it. Something happened to this place; it used to be good. Even their cucumber salad came out with half withered cucumber! What. The. Heck. 
Needless to say, this wasn't the first time they failed me. It's happened enough times for me to write this review. The service seems to be worse too. I get that I shouldn't expect any great service here but honestly, serving hella salty food and not offering water when prompted is just mean.
author: Tu L.

description: Customer service here is alright.  But you don't come to this place for the service- you come for the food.   This is my go-to Thai spot, and I mostly order carry out from here rather than come in.  The Pad Z-ew is a must as well as any of the curries!!! Also love that the Vegetarian options.  Go there if you want great food!!!
author: Liz B.

description: I live in the neighborhood and have been here 50+ times. It gets 5 stars for the dining experience - you can usually get seated promptly, the food comes out quickly, the portions are large, and most importantly, it's dependable. I have tried many things on the menu and everything is super solid. That's the theme of the restaurant- super solid. And it's open late. The soups are really good, the chicken broth is light and not too salty.
author: Celeste B.

description:
Formerly known as King of Thai Noodle (changed for "political reasons") and still essentially the same restaurant King's Thai Cuisine offers solid Thai food at a reasonable price and is open late. King's Thai is conveniently located on Clement & 4th right by the Inner Richmond bar circuit: The Bitter End, Abby Tavern, Ireland's 32, Plough & The Stars, Neck of the Woods, and Fizzee's are all within a short walking distance of King's Thai Cuisine. As a result many trips have been made here inebriated on the way home from said bars. 

But to dismiss King's Thai Cuisine as simply "drunchie" food would do them a disservice. King's Thai stands the test and tastes good when you are sober as well. The restaurant is convenient, the service is decent, and the food comes fast and is good. When you are craving Thai with large portions (always leftovers for later) on a reasonably low budget this is the place to be. 

My personal favorite dishes are the Panang Curry (red curry + peanut sauce s/w meat + onions & peppers), the Yellow Curry (s/w meat + potatoes, onions, carrots), the Pad See Ew (flat noodles + meat in soy glaze sauce s/w egg * Chinese broccoli), and Tom Kha (a rich soup made from coconut milk, chicken stock, ginger, lime, & fish sauce s/w mushrooms onions and choice of meat).
author: Tomas K.

description: I went here on a Sunday with a few other people and it was perfect for the gloomy SF weather. We were all craving a little bit of comfort food, and what better for that than some warm curry dishes?   Anyways, we started off with some jasmine and ginger tea to start. Both were fantastic! For my main course - I had the Gai Pad Med Ma-Muang (I think that's what it was called!). I loved my dish! Perfect amount of spice. Two other people in my group got the Panang Curry, which definitely gave me food envy! I have to get that the next time I go to King's. The last person in our group got Thai fried rice which was great as well. Overall, all of the food was incredibly fresh and colorful. Highly recommend!
author: Teresa C.

description: The food was alright. I ordered the Pad See Ew with chicken and there was little meat. What stood out to me as poor was the service. It was very slow before I could get my order taken. Also, (a personal pet peeve of mine) they require a $15 minimum for using cards. All in all, a relatively poor experience.
author: Robert A.

description: 4 stars for their delicious Thai food. Tom yum soup, pad kee Mao, crab rangoons, basil leaf beef, and crab fried rice. This is definitely a regular food spot for me!
author: Amanda R.

description: A thai spot that's always been my mom's to-go spot. We come for lunch and grab take-out from here often but have noticed that their portions have decreased with an increase in price. Service isn't bad, but sometimes the food takes a bit to come out. I usually order the Tom-Yum soup with thin rice noodles, pad see ew, or pad thai. Can't go wrong with those orders. Lots of seating, but parking may not be too easy to find.
author: Amanda C.

description: Red Curry is one of my favourite dishes in the world. I have been enjoying it all my life but the first time ever eating at this restaurant the red curry was the worst i have ever had in my life. Never ever am i coming back to this. It took the waiters until the main course arrived to serve water even.
author: Sandeep B.

description:
This used to be my favorite Thai restaurant and was really good until they started skimping on the meat in their fried rice, raised their prices, and cared less and less about customer service. 

I don't eat here anymore neither would I recommend it to my friends or anyone, but at the same time it doesn't hurt to try this spot out since some people still acknowledge this restaurant. It's not like their food is nasty, but there are better Thai restaurants that has better service and better food with the same prices you are paying here.
author: B. R.

description:
I work here in the neighborhood and tried this place for lunch for the first time today. Food was pretty good and the service was very good as well. But when I dropped a credit card on the check and the waiter tells me they have a $15 minimum charge for credit cards, that's when things went downhill. 

I asked if he could just add the difference as a tip to make the total come to $15 and he said no. So I paid with cash, left two pennies and a note explaining that he should read their service agreement with Visa and Mastercard which specifically prohibits enforcing a minimum charge for using credit cards. If you're going to enforce a rule like that, legal or not, you should at the very least have the courtesy to post a LARGE sign or sign on each table. 

So to save a few pennies, they lose a weekly customer (I really liked the food!!) and the waiter gets no tip and they get a nasty 1-star yelp review. Ridiculous. Who #$%@& does that?
author: Larry K.

description:
My husband and I stumbled in here after a long day spent at Outside Lands. This place is open until 2am, so great for the late night munchies :).  
We shared a massive order which included Pad Kee Mao, Pineapple fried Rice and Rad Nau. It all came out so quickly and everything tastes fresh. I would prefer my food spicier (I always think medium is "spicy" in Thai food terms and was still finding myself adding chili) but it was still very very delicious. 
Our server was very helpful and quick to refill our drinks and clear our plates. Even at midnight, the entire restaurant was packed!
author: Amala S.

description:
This location used to be called King of Thai, for any that are wondering! 

Whenevs I come to king of Thai, I always order the pad se ew with chicken. This time a friend and I ordered the pad se ew with duck. It was supa nomz.. Idk how they do it but it's always super tasty and never bland! We also ordered the Tom yum and the portion is defs enough for at least 3-4 people so we had a lot left over to share. The soup was sour and also had a nice kick of spice!
author: Krystal O.

description:
Rude service here as well, and it was to go!

It was like pulling teeth to get those little plastic Solo cups so I could take some hot sauce home with my order, and I'll not bore you with the details, but the waitress deliberately played dumb by acting a passive-aggressive twat bc she didn't want to follow my simple request: Can I please have 3 little plastic cups so I can take home some sauces? Why this turned into a major problem is beyond me.

The soups are OK, but nothing great. They all suffer from the ingredients being added much too early in the cooking, so the meat is bland, rubbery, and tasteless, as is the shrimp.
author: Rob C.

description:
+1 for their portions
+1 for their taste (disclaimer: don't know what authentic Thai food tastes like)
+1 for the price

Overall, I enjoyed my meal here, and would definitely come back.
author: Susan A.

description: This place was really good a couple years ago, but has just been slowly going down hill, probably the kitchen staff has changed. I'd say it is best described a sloppy Chinese version of Thai food. It passes as food, but nothing delicious.
author: Andy B.

description: Suggestion on vege entree, more veggies instead of rice! Come on man, at least you got it right with the heat. Why is the food so mediocre in the "Inner Richmond"? Answer: because drones put up with it. This place should only be frequented in an emergency.
author: Henry K.

description: After a glowing recommendation our lyft driver, we decided to see what the hype was all about. Food was good, and well priced. An easy, tasty meal - and open late!
author: Nicholas S.

description: Terrible service! Had lunch for Mother's Day with my mom and grandma and my table was ignored 15 minutes after we were seated! Unacceptable! It was not even that busy! Plenty of open tables around me. When I tried to get someone's attention, I was completely ignored! When I said excuse me a little louder, a waitress currently helping a customer rudely turned her head to me said I am helping another customer. I was not even trying to get her attention but another waiter. They do not value customer service at all. If you want your day to be ruined, come here.
author: Ysabel E.

description:
Late night: 
Atmosphere: 
Delicious food: 
$-$$: 

Service: just 

If you're looking for blow your mind spectacular, this probably isn't the spot for you. If your looking for late night, delicious comforting thai food that will leave you satisfied and won't break your wallet....then you found it! 

Calamari: delicious (but hit or miss)
Chicken wings: friends loved it! A little sweet  for me.
Yellow chicken curry: average
Tom Kah: mmmmmm
Tom yum: 
Pad seew: 

Beer after Midnight:  sorry Cinderella.
author: Erika K.

description: My partner and I shared the crab rangoon and pad see ew. We both ordered Thai iced too. The food was good and the portions were perfect for two people to share. The service was very expedient! Very quick with getting our food, and very polite too. I am totally coming here again. :) Solid place for dinner or lunch.
author: Joanne H.

description:
I don't know what the low ratings are for, but we had a great experience here! Customer service was great-friendly folks here.

Tom Yum Soup (seafood) - the ingredients were fresh! The broth's flavor just spreads through your mouth. Delicious soup!

Spicy Calamari - one of the best calamaris I've had! Must try!

Eggplant with Chicken (Sorry, forgot the name. It's the first item under the rice plates section of the menu) - this item is really good! From the sauce to the veggies and chicken-just yum!
author: Jam A.

description: It's okay please not so not so special the  fried chicken or fried rice that's pretty good sometimes it gets way too crowded it's a nice clean place over there sometimes the base of the music is way too loud
author: Jonathan S.

description: Seated Upon arrival. No long wait. Food was delicious and came to our table quickly. A little under staff as we had to remind waiter to fill our water glasses, but overall food and service a 5 stars. I recommend the Tom Yum Soup and cream cheese rangoons.
author: Terri E.

description: I've been a loyal patron of King's Thai since it was King of Thai II. To give you an idea, I was at King of Thai (and already a longtime patron by that time) when I first found out Aaliyah (R.I.P.) had passed away. Imagine hearing that news somewhere else! Where would you get comfort food from then?! All kidding aside, my family and I have always loved the ease at which you could order up a plate of no-frills, hearty, tasty Thai food for less than $10 a dish. And the variety of sauces on the table! No other place compared. We would eat in, order out, and come to King of Thai on the fly. The restaurant, it seems, has upgraded in recent years. Since I no longer live in the neighborhood, it was a surprise to me how much they changed up their appearance. They took down all wall signs, replaced one of their walls with a dark wood, and kept one side with the original wall-to-wall mirrors. Their menus are no longer paper and plastic.. they upgraded to a fancy leather bound version. The menu appears to be the same, but the portions are smaller. They unfortunately do not have the same variety of sauces and peppers that they used to have. =\ I ordered a Thai tea and roast duck over rice. I'm used to having leftovers, but I pretty much consumed the entire thing (save a few pieces.. I was really trying to practice some self control and not overeat). Like most restaurants have done in the past few years or so, they also raised prices. I have to say, though, King's Thai still has impeccable service. I noticed one waiter who has stayed on from their pre-renovation staff, and everyone kept checking up on us from time to time. I still highly recommend coming here. Do not expect huge portions, but rely on the fact that you can have a tasty meal over here.
author: Monica M.

description:
This is my favorite place to get Thai take out near my house. Our go to order is Tom Kha with chicken and Pad Kee Mao with chicken. The Tom Kha never dissappoints! Always super flavorful, which sometimes in an issue with other places in the area. The Pad Kee Mao can range from mildly spicy to inedibly spicy depending on the day, which for me is an issue, but my boyfriend loves everything fiery and hot so on those days he's even happier. 

When you dine in, the staff is friendly and prompt. The tables are all crammed in there, so you're sitting pretty close to the people at the tables nearby...hence why we always get takeout....
author: Christa N.

description: Don't get the bad reviews. Food is pretty bomb and it's open super late. What more can you ask for?
author: Rahul B.

description: This used to be my go-to Thai spot for their amazing Pad See You and yummy fried rices, but since they changed names (and separated from "King of Thai") and did their remodel, their prices are a bit too high for me now. A to-go order of Pad See You is now over $10! It still tasted great, but I'm not sure if this is worth it to me anymore, especially because portions seem to be slightly smaller as well...
author: Sabrina L.

description:
This used to be my go-to for take-out when it was "King of Thai," but after experiencing the service and food tonight, I will not be returning.  After ordering and paying for my to-go order, I sat down in the half-empty restaurant at a table in the corner, only to be told by a server that the group entering was going to be seated there.  I was advised to sit by the benches leading to the bathroom, and after realizing the space was affecting my appetite, I decided to abandon the benches.  Walking past the same table I sat, I saw that there was no one seated there. I told another server that since I wasn't allowed to sit at any of the tables, I would wait outside.  (I hadn't canceled my order because I already paid for it.)  

Perhaps it was the bad taste left in my mouth from the service, but after I got home, the food was quite bland despite dousing it with the chili paste that I had at home.  (I agree with one other reviewer who noted the restaurant doesn't welcome customers to take any of the sauces to-go by providing plastic containers -- which it used to provide when it was King of Thai.)
author: p. w.

description: SO disappointed. I live around the corner and frequent this place for late night eats. Have to say that the last two times have been mediocre at best. I ordered the garlic eggplant vegetarian over rice and received not one piece of eggplant. Just a pile of rice and a bunch of veggies and tofu. Not to say that's not good, but I paid for the dish with eggplant and it just wasn't there. This has happened before and the last time I ordered pad see ew there wasn't any chicken and the noodles were a half portion. Unacceptable. So bummed. Because this used to be my go to. Guess I'll just have to hit up Safeway for snacks.
author: Stefani S.

description:
This is the place that use to be King of Thai.
