I only came here because it was open late. The first few times I've been here, I thought I was at a King of Thai. I just thought that the food quality was better at this location for some reason. It took me many trips when I realized...wait a minute, the menu says King's Thai Cuisine.

The food quality is always really good here but it's rather inconsistent in terms of how they make it which I don't mind that much (sometimes I can feel the heat of the cooking vessel through the food which is nice sometimes but if it's overdone, can yield a really an unpleasant, smoky sensation). This place has a menu that's similar to King of Thai and Chabaa Thai but it's better in many aspects and at a similar price point. 

Recs:
* Any curry
* Any of the specials
* That beef stew noodle soup with flat rice noodles 
* Any fried noodle dish

Do not get: 
Those angel wings. SO HO HUM. That's all I think. I don't normally order anything that's not from above list. 


The service can be really rude.
author: Margaret S.

description: Been going to this place for many years and saw the transition from just a Thai restaurant, to a nice looking one. I recommend to get as drink the Thai iced tea. I usually get Pad see Ew, chicken or beef friend rice, cashew nut chicken, or even their yellow curry. The food is good, and the service could be better but I am not whining.
author: Paulo R.

description:
their food is always fresh and portions are huge. came here twice for lunch and ordered their duck panang curry and duck green curry. After i was finished, the bowls of curry were licked clean. 

Nuff said
author: Philip T.

description: The seats are really comfy. The interior is well decorated as well. My personal favorite is the Pad Kee Mao. I've come here in the past and the food is still just as good as I remember it! 10/10 would come again!
author: Rebecca C.

description: I remember the portions being much larger and the prices much lower. I could be wrong but the food didn't taste as good but was sufficient in filling me up. They could work on keeping the floors a tad cleaner too.
author: Rosalind S.

description: Oh yay!!!! So I've been coming to King of Thai of clement street for years!!! And they remodeled and changed the name! Anyways, I love both King's Thai Cuisine on clement street but this one is my favorite because of the spaciousness. I recommend their specials, they're always unique than a lot of the stuff you find at Thai restaurants. From the regular menu I really like the combination beef noodle soup with wide noodle and the fried chicken over fried rice. If I need a little spice in my life, I'd order the pad prik khink with chicken and a fried egg on top (make it spicy). The sangria is so good here (better than Cha Cha cha's in my opinion). For dessert I would get the mango sticky rice!!! Love this place, definitely will always come back!
author: Keerati C.

description: Party of 7 @ 6pm. Ordered Pad See-Ew Beef even says it on receipt at final bill. We got chicken instead. Family was too hungry to send back. Still gave 15% tip despite lack of attentive service.
author: Vincent V.

description: CAN WE GIVE NEGATIVE STARS? My experience at this place was horrible. I paid for the scenery. It is over priced for the quality of food I received. The food I ordered was not up to par at all. The waitresses did not pay attention to detail. I ordered wings never received them, also I asked for the check to be split, that did not happen. What sent me over the edge with this place was the mysterious hard object in my food that almost broke my tooth. I will not step foot into this place again. Will continue to go to BEST OF THAI NOODLE ON HAIGHT ST.
author: Elonte' P.

description: I live around the block and visit Kings Thai about once a week. I love this place! The services always friendly and fast and they have a nice seating area for take out. I highly recommend the green curry and the fresh spring rolls. If you are in the neighborhood, be sure to check it out!
author: Laura L.

description:
a little pricey for Thai food but it's pretty damn delicious. everything i've ordered here has been spot on... except for the spring rolls and peanut sauce, which weren't that great.

i will disagree with another reviewer who says they don't correct their mistakes. my lady ordered a dish with pork but it came with shrimp--they quickly corrected this when we told them about it.
author: Ronny K.

description:
Have visited here before and found food very tasty...
Visited yesterday for lunch and was so disappointed, I won't step foot in here again.
The waitperson could not seem to get our three orders correct, even when we pointed to the items on the menu.
She came back 5 minutes later and tried to communicate something to us, but was impossible to understand. She finally brought back a menu and was confirming our orders, again!
10 minutes later she brought one order, it was wrong.
8 minutes later, brought order number 2 of 3, this one was correct.
She would not stop long enough to hear our complaint that the first dish was incorrect.
She came back out after my companions had finished half of their meals, to confirm (in Thai) what my order was.
5 minutes later she showed up with my salad.
I told her I was no longer hungry, I was very disappointed about the service and that I did not expect to pay for the salad, that arrived almost 20 minutes after the first dish was served.
She said something, but none of us could understand what she said, she then walked away.
The bill came and the salad WAS on the bill. I tried to explain, but to no avail.
Decided to cut our losses. Paid the bill, NO tip.
Will not return EVER. Wow!
author: Doug W.

description: Omg what an awful service from two Asian waitress absolutely they don't know how to treat customers!!! Stay away!!! Never go over there!!
author: Denis A.

description: Consistent, tasty & late hours - and there are locations around the city.  Also a solid choice for weeknight takeout.
author: Sean P.

description: Great atmosphere and amazing Thai food! Always come here with my mates when we're want something decent but not too pricy.
author: Sherry F.

description: I was already unhappy with their poor customer service & low food quality on my first visit: then I learn that their prices went up 30% a while back, so their online menu prices are outdated. When I got the bill, I had to pay double of what the manager told me my meal was going to be. In addition, their loud, obnoxious patrons ruined the dining experience for me even more, so I'll never come back to this place.
author: Josh J.

description: The food is very mediocre, absolutely nothing special. The sweet and sour soup was a very spicy broth with a few shrimp swimming around, so definitely don't recommend it. The portions are tiny, they're more rice and barely any meat. Definitely not worth the price. Got two dishes and a soup,paid $35, really wished I would have ordered from somewhere else tonight.
author: alla k.

description: I don't know why there's any high ratings. In my opinion the food is below average for a thai restaurant and the service is horrible. If you're a local, you would know how that sad legacy of this place kept getting worse and worse through the years till they changed the name but just not the problems of the restaurant. Aiye, but I'm sure it would entertain the palette of an out of towny who didn't know any other fine restaurants the Richmond district has to offer. Save yourself the headache and stomach ache that follows
author: Jas P.

description: Open late night in downtown. Noodle dish was good. Don't bother with the Satay.
author: Nandita V.

description: This place is so convenient, it isn't gross inside. You walk in through a tiny entrance that shows their cook space which might freak you out or set you off if you see a fly from the streets of Clement wander in which is highly likely. You are instantly greeted as this is also where the wait staff stand. The seating itself is very limited as this restaurant is really small. They're open nice and late so when you have a hankering for some inexpensive Thai this could be your go to spot. Their tea is delicious. I think I can drink so many cups of it and they happily refill! The problem with this place is that it's hard to find parking sometimes and they don't accept credit card. A lot of spots here don't but this one really should. People aren't running around with tons of cash especially not late at night. Cheap eats, quick eats... No credit cards! Boo!
author: Paula P.

description: Waiter was very rude, very few words. Took my order once the food came it had chicken instead of beef. I asked to change it,  they did but no sorry or anything. Once beef curry order came it has small pieces of chicken of my other order.  So I thought in my head they took the chicken out and put some beef and served it right back, it was barely warm too. I wont come there again
author: Duke B.

description: This place was pretty great. The atmosphere is pretty laid back but happy. The food is great, especially the red curry. The ginger tea is also on point!
author: Eric M.

description: Just made a simple pick up order for a common Thai soup, then arrived home to find it missing listed ingredients and tasting far too sweet. I've made this same order to dozens of Thai places, and what I just ate was not even recognizable.
author: Lucas S.

description:
Good Thai food and beverages. Nice size portions - always leftovers.
Open till 2:00am - love this!
Clean and friendly.
author: nancy l.

description: We tried this restaurant since we were in the area and craving Thai food. We were very pleasantly surprised! We ordered the combo beef soup with flat rice noodles, stir fried spicy green beans with beef, and shrimp pad thai. All of the dishes were flavorful. The noodles in the soup were not as firm as we would have liked and we were hoping for more stewed beef meat and less tendon. However, the broth was rich and flavorful. The pad thai was delicious. It wasn't too sweet and the prawns were large and well seasoned. The tofu was nice and crunchy. The stir fried green beans with meat were spicy and flavorful. We would definitely come back!
author: Ryan Y.

description: Ordered the yellow curry and it was good. Service was fast and I like the dim atmosphere
author: Paola T.

description: Three star. Food was decent although there are other places that are better in sf. Ie king of thai noodle. The original one. This place looks a little more modern and the food is...just ok, but the service is horrible. Customer service is not only slow but somewhat rude I understand they are busy, but when you screw up a customers order, you should apologize and make sure the customers get the stuff asap. Instead we ended up getting two  of the same order and one other order.  then we had to reorder the one we originally wanted. Of course we also paid for all four orders, which is fine since we ate it. But the last order took forever t Po come I out. When asked about it, they were even very nice ab I it it  rude! When I got up to leave they just stare at you. Never coming back
author: Jenny T.

description: I don't know why this place has low ratings. The food is great and cheap! I love the dimly lit atmosphere with the mirrored walls. AND it's open until 2AM!!
author: Brian M.

description: I got the green curry with chicken and brown rice. SOOOO GOOD. A++++. Highly recommend.
author: Caitlyn M.

description: I thoroughly enjoyed the yellow curry, pad thai and angel dried wings. Take me back!
author: Sweets N.

description: Decent food. The service was a bit absent. Nothing to write home about.
author: Grey Z.

description: The food is great but the portions are very small for the price. Like when you order a curry dish,the container is barely half full and most dishes are over 10 dollars. Also,the curry puffs are  pricey,considering they only give you 3. Aside from that,I find the wait staff quite rude. They never seem very welcoming and are often brusk and unfriendly. I only go here because it's convenient. Usually I hate giving rude people my money because I think it sets a bad precendent that it's okay to treat the customer like crap.
author: Pasha S.

description: Got time to kill? Nowhere to be? Want some decent but not overly amazing Thai food? Then rock on. This is your place. I love, love, love this neighborhood and wish I lived here but that's another story. We were craving Thai food and this definitely hit the spot. But the things is: we waited and we waited and we waited....to even get some kind of attention after we had already waited and waited and waited just to be seated! We started to make bets and then we made a plan to leave if we didn't get served in...X amount of minutes. We ended up staying because our server arrived just in the nick of time. It was THAT slow. I totally get that meals don't have to be rushed and really shouldn't be rushed if you can help it - and we weren't even in a particular hurry - but we were very thirsty and also quite hungry after an afternoon at the deYoung. And when you're thirsty and hungry, this kind of waiting is just irritating. Ok now onto the food: as I said, decent but not amazing. I ordered Tom Yum Goon with chicken (one of my favorites) and it was tasty but the broth was a bit heavy for my liking. My husband and our friend ordered other dishes. One was a duck salad and the other was served in an actual coconut. Our friend LOVED his coconut curry dish, my husband said his salad was just OK. Would I return? Yeah, sure, why not. I'll just make sure I'm not parched or starving. The people here are really nice, but the service is just slow as all hell.
author: Jessica C.

description: Food is decent for the price, but never order delivery. I live 2 blocks away and delivery took over 2 hours because they forgot the order. When I called to ask about my food after an hour and a half, it was obvious they forgot to put the order in. It took another hour still because they ran all the other deliveries first. Horrible customer service. And the delivery guy has the nerve to ask "what about my tip?"
author: Sally K.

description: We had Pad Thai and Pumpkin Curry and they were excellently tasty, especially given how inexpensive the menu is at King's Thai. The most important part of my review  happened after I left the restaurant, though: I somehow left my wallet at the table and when I realized this the next day at lunchtime, I gave them a call and they quickly confirmed that they had it. Picked it up and all cards and cash were still inside -- thanks for the food and the excellent service, King's Thai!
author: Christina O.

description: I came here for the first time 5/5/15 mid-afternoon when it was quiet.  There were only two other diners besides myself in the room.  I was hungry and ordered the Grilled Honey Pork special and Yellow Chicken Curry.  The waitress suggested the sticky rice that came with the Pork would be sufficient for the curry and that I wouldn't need more. She delivered the food and I never saw her again to ask how I liked the food or if I needed anything else.  I thought the pork would be cut up in cubes. Instead, it was served as 3 thin slices which were predominantly 3/4 fat.  I was very disappointed.  The yellow curry was in a bowl so large it looked like soup with little else in it.  My spoon did discover pieces of chicken and some potato. I brought the fatty pork to the restaurant's attention but they did nothing about it saying I should have said something before eating it.  The glaze however hid the fat until you were actually cutting it up.  By the amount of fatty meat left on my plate I thought it was obvious. Most places would have apologized and offered something.  Won't be returning here.
author: Anne N.
